I should go - rewrite - ME3.description: The overuse of this generic line makes conversations feel robotic and non-organic.

We doing this? - rewrite - Cyberpunk 207.original: Are we doing this or what?
We doing this? - rewrite - Cyberpunk 207.description: Line often repeated by Panam, making her feel like a bot

The fate of New Vegas - rewrite - Fallou.original: You do realize the fate of New Vegas hangs in the balance?
The fate of New Vegas - rewrite - Fallou.description: Very repeated line from Mr. House

We should talk - rewrite - Red Dead Rede.original: Arthur, I reckon we should talk about that job.
We should talk - rewrite - Red Dead Rede.description: Line that is repeated many times by Hosea

Geralt, stop by later - rewrite - The Wi.original: Geralt, do stop by later. We have much to discuss.
Geralt, stop by later - rewrite - The Wi.description: She will repeat this over and over, never giving details, until you actually trigger the mission. Thorbjørn: annoyingly repetitive, maybe feels Immersion Breaking, as most people don't repeat the same sentence over and over.

Aloy, are you ready? - rewrite - Horizon.original: Aloy, are you ready to face what comes next?
Aloy, are you ready? - rewrite - Horizon.description: You can go explore for 30 hours, and he just keeps repeating this line, stuck in waiting mode. Thorbjørn: annoyingly repetitive, maybe feels Immersion Breaking, as most people don't repeat the same sentence over and over.

Shepard, focus - rewrite - ME3.original: Shepard, we need to focus on the real fight.
Shepard, focus - rewrite - ME3.description: Even if you’re off playing space poker or scanning planets for hours, he just repeats the same urgency without context.Thorbjørn: Lack of increase in urgency feels weird.

Hello, my love - rewrite - Skyrim.original: Hello, my love. Back from another adventure?
Hello, my love - rewrite - Skyrim.description: They just stand in your house repeating this generic line forever.
